meanings.definition: A person who buys and sells old or used goods.
meanings.sent1: The junker sold many old items at the flea market.
meanings.sent2: The junker had a shop full of secondhand treasures.
meanings.sent3: The junker found a hidden gem among the dusty relics.
meanings.sent4: In the world of antiques, the junker was a true connoisseur.
meanings.sent5: The junker's keen eye spotted valuable items others overlooked.

meanings.sent1: The junker in the backyard was covered in rust.
meanings.sent2: Driving around town in a junker made him feel nostalgic.
meanings.sent3: The junker sputtered and coughed like an old man waking up.
meanings.sent4: The junker's engine roared to life after years of neglect.
meanings.sent5: The junker's faded paint told stories of past adventures.

meanings.definition: To discard or get rid of something.
meanings.sent1: She decided to junker the broken vase.
meanings.sent2: After the party, they had to junker the leftover food.
meanings.sent3: He junkered his old clothes to make space in the closet.
meanings.sent4: The decision to junker the project was a tough one.
meanings.sent5: They had to junker the idea due to lack of resources.
